text: "拷밧m캐t ad-Diy캐r" (, , ; "Guardians of the Homeland") is the national anthem of Syria. It was adopted in 1936. ==Lyrics== ===Arabic original=== Arabic script Romanization (EALL) IPA transcription ===Syriac lyrics=== Syriac alphabet Transliteration 1 gn킕tr킕y 킕tr캒콞t 코l킕m gl캩kn Ik캶l캶 n킕p코h y킕q콞r콞t dnsgrun m캒rb캒콞gt g킕rb콞t콞 b킕yty hhrm콞 w킕-grs콞 d코m코h byt콞 k캒s캒 l콞 ntt킕l캒m 洧 rbg킕t콞 d-코'캐m mkdlh nn dr킕m콞 b캒mg킕ly콞t hdr콞 ntd캒my콞n I코m킕y콞 洧 tr콞 dn z-hi b코m코h n킕hrt콞 코m킕y콞 h콞bh킕yk 킕w 킕km d코m킕y콞! 2 r콞h콞p콞t s킕kh w킕rp콞h콞 dlb콞 g캩l캶 n코콞 dl킕md kn코y콞 d캒tr킕t콞 lyt bh key m캩n k콞l g킕ynn 킕w k콞mt콞 wlt bh 캒r캒m캩n dm콞 d캒콞k콞l s킕hdn dyt콞? 洧 n킕p코콞t콞 r콞m콞t콞 킕gbr콞 n캒s캶h콞 wrhu d킕gl킕t콞 rqb킕w 킕t캶d콞 洧 dt min킕n 킕l- w킕l캶d 킕tb 킕t 킕r-r킕코캶d l콞m콞 key l콞 n코t캒l캒t w킕lm콞 l콞 n캒q캣ym? ===English translations=== Literal translation Artistic translation by Muhaned Elhindi I Guardians of the homeland, upon you be peace, [our] proud spirits refuse to be humiliated. The den of Arabism is a sacred sanctuary, and the throne of the suns is a preserve that will not be subjugated. 洧 The quarters of Levant are towers in height, which are in dialogue with the zenith of the skies. 洧 A land resplendent with brilliant suns, becoming another sky or almost a sky. II The flutter of hopes and the beat of the heart, are on a flag that united the entire country. Is there not blackness from every eye, and ink from every martyr's blood? 洧 [Our] spirits are defiant and [our] history is glorious, and our martyrs' souls are formidable guardians. 洧 From us is al-Wal캶d, and from us is al-Rash캶d. So why then shall we not lead, why then shall we not rise? I Guardians of homeland, upon you be peace, our ever-proud souls refuse to be seized. The den of Arabism is our sacred home, and the throne of our suns will never go down. 洧 The mountains of Syria are towers in height, which talk with the zenith of the highest skies. 洧 A land that is splendid with brilliant sun, turning to a sky or almost a sky. II The flutter of our hopes and the beats of our hearts, depicted on the flag that united our land. Did we not derive the black from every man's eye, and from ink of martyrs' blood wrote to the tall sky? 洧 Spirits defiant and past so glorious, and the martyrs' souls are our guardians. 洧 From us, a nation of souls and bravery, Thy glory comes from us, my homeland! == References == == Other websites == *http://nationalanthems.info/sy.htm Category:Syrian culture Category:Asian anthems Category:1936 works
title: Humat ad-Diyar
